a.title: Last Day of School - Full Day

div.a: Last Day of School - Full Day May 29, ,

a.title: First Day of School K - 9 & Emerson

div.a: First Day of School K - 9 & Emerson August 26, ,
First Day of School Grades 10-12 August 27, ,
Teacher Work Day - No School November 23, ,
Closure Extended Though End of Year

p.br: The Board of Trustees has made the difficult decision to extend the soft closure and continue remote learning through the end of the school year. While some COVID-19 restrictions are slowly being lifted, it is clear some form of social distancing will remain in effect, which will make it difficult, if not impossible, to open our schools. We recognize remote learning has its challenges, but we hope this decision will give our students, parents and staff some clarity about what to expect in the next few weeks. We appreciate the extraordinary work our teachers are doing to engage students, and also the incredible support we’ve had from parents during this difficult time. Read Update. See FAQ. Resources for Families Affected By COVID-19.

span.p: We are sad to report the Idaho High School Athletics Association announced TODAY, Friday, April 17, that it is canceling all spring sports and activities seasons and state tournaments. We are working on on the easiest way to refund activities fees. Please watch for more information next week. IHSAA Press Release.

p.br: April 30th is the deadline for the Ed Foundations Maeck and Odd Fellows Scholarship. We extended this deadline because of Covid-19 and we wanted to give seniors a chance to apply for this great opportunity. We want all of our students to go on after high school. Right now is a trying time but we don’t want them to lose hope or be discouraged when it comes to their future. There is still time to apply! Reach out to us with any questions at edfoundation@d91.k12.id.us!

span.p:
Stay Safe. Follow the links below to apply.
Maeck Family Foundation Application
Odd Fellows Scholarship Application

p.br:
In these unprecedented times our teachers and staff are committed to helping children learn. We created the D91 Learning Center to provide parents with ideas and resources aligned to our curriculum. Feel free to explore the D91 Learning Center for materials that may help your child as they learn at home. Explore the Learning Center.
Enjoy & Take Care!

D91’s “Grab ‘n Go” food program is designed to support families impacted by the school closure. Any family with children aged 1 to 18 are eligible to pick up a “Grab ‘n Go” meal at one of 16 stops. The meal includes a free breakfast and lunch. Children must be present to receive a meal. Adults can also purchase meals for $6.60, but they must have exact change. Please check times because they vary. See Locations & Times. Click here for the map.

As eastern Idaho is beginning to see cases of community transmission of the COVID-19 virus it’s more important than ever that people adhere to the governor’s stay-at-home order, which is in effect through April 15. As we continue providing services because education is deemed “essential” under the order, we urge everyone to follow guidance from local, state and federal health officials. Learn more at COVID-19 Page.

div.p: Idaho Falls School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to all individuals. Learn More.

h4.span: Verify your school has your cell phone number in PowerSchool and text Yes to 67587.

h5.em: To stop receiving text messages text the word STOP to 67587.
